batchResolveMarkets(bytes32[],uint256[],.details: Arrays must have equal length, enables efficient bulk resolution

getConditionId(address,bytes32,uint256,u.details: Matches condition ID generation used in other contracts

returns._0: Merkle root hash, zero if not resolved

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

resolveMarketEpoch(bytes32,uint256,uint2.details: Oracle can resolve any epoch, enables flexible resolution timing

params.merkleRoot: Root hash of merkle tree containing valid outcomes
params.numberOfOutcomes: Number of possible outcomes for validation

params._oracle: Address of oracle for market resolution

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateEmergencyResolver(address).details: Only callable by contract owner, for emergency situations

updateOracle(address).details: Only callable by contract owner, for emergency situations

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params.selectedOutcome: Outcome being verified (1 or 2 for binary)

batchResolveMarkets(bytes32[],uint256[],.notice: Batch resolves multiple market epochs for gas efficiency

getConditionId(address,bytes32,uint256,u.notice: Generates condition ID for market resolution

getResolutionRoot(bytes32).notice: Gets merkle root for resolved condition

getResolutionStatus(bytes32).notice: Checks if condition has been resolved

isResolved(bytes32).notice: Tracks which conditions have been resolved to prevent re-resolution

resolutionMerkleRoots(bytes32).notice: Maps condition ID to merkle root for outcome verification

resolveMarketEpoch(bytes32,uint256,uint2.notice: Resolves specific market epoch by setting merkle root

setEmergencyResolver(address).notice: Sets the authorized emergency resolver address
